funcs.name: apache_note
funcs.desc:
This function is a wrapper for Apache's table_get and table_set. It edits the table of notes that exists during a request. The table's purpose is to allow Apache modules to communicate.

The main use for apache_note() is to pass information from one module to another within the same request.

return.desc: If called with one argument, it returns the current value of note note_name. If called with two arguments, it sets the value of note note_name to note_value and returns the previous value of note note_name. If the note cannot be retrieved, FALSE is returned.

funcs.name: apache_request_headers
funcs.desc: Fetches all HTTP request headers from the current request. This function is only supported when PHP is installed as an Apache module.

return.desc: An associative array of all the HTTP headers in the current request, or FALSE on failure.
An array of all Apache response headers on success or FALSE on failure.

funcs.name: apache_setenv
funcs.desc:
apache_setenv() sets the value of the Apache environment variable specified by variable.

When setting an Apache environment variable, the corresponding $_SERVER variable is not changed.

return.desc: Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

args.name: variable
args.desc: The environment variable that's being set.

args.name: walk_to_top
args.desc: Whether to set the top-level variable available to all Apache layers.

funcs.name: getallheaders
funcs.desc:
Fetches all HTTP headers from the current request.

This function is an alias for apache_request_headers(). Please read the apache_request_headers() documentation for more information on how this function works. This function is only supported when PHP is installed as an Apache module.

return.desc: An associative array of all the HTTP headers in the current request, or FALSE on failure.
